benchmark_details.name: PRISM (Prompt Template Stealing Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: PRISM is a benchmark for prompt template stealing consisting of 50 templates and 450 images, organized into Easy and Hard difficulty levels.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically study the prompt template stealing attack and evaluate the vulnerability of visual language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark's single-subject design limits its applicability to multi-subject templates in real-world applications.

data.source: Templates sourced from PromptBase and LaPrompt, with images generated using DALLÂ·E 3.
data.annotation: Templates were manually curated for subject-prompt alignment and stylistic consistency.

methodology.calculation: Fitness function based on semantic and style similarity.
methodology.interpretation: Higher similarity scores indicate better template reproduction and generalization capabilities.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments were conducted across both open-source and closed-source models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The capability to extract templates may pose risks to creators' intellectual property even without fine-tuning.
